problem_metadata.title: Maximum Average Subarray I
problem_metadata.content:
You are given an integer array nums consisting of n elements, and an integer k.

Find a contiguous subarray whose length is equal to k that has the maximum average value and return this value. Any answer with a calculation error less than 10-5 will be accepted.

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [1,12,-5,-6,50,3], k = 4
Output: 12.75000
Explanation: Maximum average is (12 - 5 - 6 + 50) / 4 = 51 / 4 = 12.75

Example 2:

Input: nums = [5], k = 1
Output: 5.00000

 

Constraints:

  • n == nums.length
  • 1 <= k <= n <= 105
  • -104 <= nums[i] <= 104

submissions.title: Maximum Average Subarray I
submissions.code:
class Solution:
    def findMaxAverage(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> float:
        # Find we find the window average.

        windowavg = (sum(nums[:k])) / k
        maxavg = windowavg # Setting the maxavg to windowavg for now.


        # Size of the input array...
        n = len(nums)

        for i in range(n - k):
            windowavg = windowavg - nums[i]/k + nums[k+i]/k
            maxavg = max(maxavg,windowavg)
        return maxavg
